text: Pours unclear red. Aroma of brett and vinegar. Taste of stable, horse (classic brett), a little cherry, lactid acid wood/barrel. Medium body, average carbonation. Yummy.

Pours hazy burgundy, pink head. Nose similar to 3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze I tried directly before (note: total beginner here), cherry and raspberry seed paste after making a syrup:) Less funky, less sour than 3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze, raspberries, cherries. This cherry is actually not so intense. Sweet. Astringent. The first kriek in life, I do my best to be objective!

W aromacie maliny, malinowa herbata, troche wisnia. Barwa burgundowa, metne, piana drobna, utrzymujaca sie. W smaku delikatnie kwasne, rowniez malinowe. Czuc tez jakies drewno, taniny. Alkoholu zupelnie nie czuc. Zaskakujace ze jest malinowe, wisnia jest lekka. Jest bardzo porzadne, ale na ratebeer top 50 troszke za slabo.
Bottle from Cask. Red with ample pink head. Smells Lightly rubbery plus smoke plus velvet. Fruity, dry.
wisnia pestka duzo stajenki wino wytrawnosc czerwone owoce. bardzo udany lambik

W aromacie wiśnie, czerwone wino, czerwone owoce, nuty dzikie. W wyglądzie czerwone ze średnią różową pianą. W smaku wiśniowe, kwaśne, czereśniowe, pestkowe, dzikie, taniczne, wytrawne. Ciało dość lekkie, pijalność spora, ułożone, eleganckie. Ogólnie bardzo przyjemny, wytrawny, kwaśny, owocowy lambic, bardzo dobre piwo.
Draft at the brewery during Toer de Gueze 2017. Reddish pink with a foamy head. Cherries, Brett, oak, lemon, medium sour with semi-dry finish. Medium-bodied.
Clear red body with a medium pink head. Aroma is sour cherries, wood, dusty. Taste is light sweet and sour. Medium body, soft carbonation, watery texture. Nice sour tart finish.

From old tasting notes. Translucent deep red color topped by a pink bubbly head. Yeasty sour cherry malt aroma. Intensely sour cherry flavor has an acidic character. Long lasting sour cherry finish and aftertaste.

Aromat: świeżutkie wiśnie zerwane prosto z drzewa i bardzo mocna stajnia. 
Wygląd: czerwono wiśniowe, z różowo wiśniową, wysoką, grubopęcherzykową warstwą piany.
Smak: świeże i soczyste wiśnie, bardzo naturalne, takie prosto z drzewa. Cierpkie, ale nie octowe, troszkę wiśniowej słodyczy, orzeźwiające i smaczne. Alkoholu zupełnie nie czuć, wysycenie średnie. Dębina wyczuwalna, w postaci ściągania na języku. Bretowe nuty wyczuwalne, ale nie tak mocno jak w aromacie. Po chwili świeże wiśnie przechodzą w niesłodzony, zimny kompot wiśniowy. Finisz kwaśny. Smaczne i pijalne piwo

Bottle 375ml, vintage 2013

Kriek ma barwę czerwonego wina, soku wiśniowego.
Piana na początku dość obfita, jasnoróżowa, z średnim tempem redukująca się do obrączki wokół szkła.
W aromacie na pierwszy plan wysuwa się przyjemna nuta wiśni, takich w całości ze skórką i pestką w środku, pachnie niczym przefermentowane czerwone wino, następnie dochodzi cała masa dzikich akcentów, takich jak świeża skóra, końska derka, lekkie nuty stajenne, zwietrzałe siano, ujawnia się także owocowa kwaśność wraz z pestkowścią wpadającą w lekki migdał. Pachnie świetnie.
W smaku dają o sobie znać wiśnie, takie lekko kwaśne, ale zarazem soczyste w środku. Kwaśność jest na umiarkowanym poziomie nie za mała i nie przesadzona. Oprócz tego dochodzą nuty funk oraz wcześniej wspomniana owocowa kwaśność. Na samym końcu można poczuć przyjemną pestkowość wpadającą miejscami w migdał.
Finisz pozostaje w tonie winno-cierpkim.
Wysycenie jest średnie, a każdy łyk piwa w ustach przyjemnie musuje na całym podniebieniu.
Całość jest pięknie zbalansowana, świetnie orzeźwia, odświeża, a pomimo dość sporego "waltażu" bardzo pijalna.
Podsumowując jest to bardzo dobry kriek, zdecydowanie lepszy od wersji oude(bez Mariage Parfait) z tego samego browaru.
Hodně dobrý kriek, s intenzivnějí a kvaenějí chutí, nicméně skvělé aroma a výborný dojezd.
Cette exquise boisson est bonne, part Dieu ! Acide, fruitée, équilibrée, succulente !

Deep red hue. Strong fruity aroma.
Tart with juicy cherriness with a frizziness.

Rated by BrewTom

Batch 5140, raccolta 2013, aperta il 27 aprile 2017.
Rosso rubino lievemente velata, schiuma rosa di ottima persistenza.
Aroma di stallatico, griotte, note di barrique.
Al palato attacca acidula con ciliegia, frumento, note di uva bianca, successivamente sempre griotte, frumento e stallatico, finale amaricante legnoso che può ricordare i noccioli di ciliegia con astringenza che riporta alla mente le sue bucce.
Discretamente beverina, corpo leggero, non troppo carbonata.
Very dark red colour with no head. Aroma and flavour are moderately dry and sour. The intensity of the cherries is toned down.

350 ml pours a rose color with a nice white head. Aromas of cherries, oak. Medium bodied, fruity, a really nice beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dębowa beczka robi swoje. Balsamiczne, eleganckie piwo, żadnych chamskich nut stajennych, wszystko idealnie wyleżakowane w dębie.

Bottled 375ml. -at Magic Beer Room Zagreb. Ruby red coloured, small pinkish head, sour dry cherries in the nose. Wood, tart cherries, light peppery and quite dry with slightly sweet notes. Again tart cherries in the finish. Really nice one.

Fijn zurig aroma. Zeer mooi bier, donder kersenkleur met mooie roze kraag. De smaak is vol en alcoholisch. Licht zurig, licht houterig. Vol, sappig en een mooie balans tussen de Lambiek en Krieken. Redelijk veel koolzuur. Zeer fijne afdronk. Absolute top.

375ml bottle (thx, Alex L.!) shared with my wife on our 11th anniversary. Vintage 2014. Pours an opaque red with a rose head. Aroma is a lambic, cherries, cherry kompot, some funk and farm notes. Taste is the same. Quite dry. Low sweetness. I would rate this higher, but I dont think that those dirty farm notes are appropriate, even if they make the beer closer to the original beer that was brewed dozens of years ago.

Bottle from Saveur beer. Pours ruby red. Nose is blackberry, Berry, cherry, balsamic vinegar. Flavour is a blackberry, bread, malt backbone which balances the tartiness. Bit of a jam finish with dry bitter end. Dry bitter fruit end. Lasting finish. Lovely.

2013 bottle. Pours deep ruby blood into a tumbler. Bright pink head with excellent retention recedes to coat surface. Cherry and oak aromas. Dry with dark oak and bitter earth upfront turning to mild, tart cherry in their lasting finish.

2013 bottle sampled in 2017. I need to drink stuff like this more often! Poured a rich ruby-purple color, initially clear but I poured the dregs, so its a cloudier richer purpler color. Nose is complex, cherries sure, but cherry stone, oak, old stale cheese, hay/straw, old barn, .Dry and tart, with dry cherry and oak, fairly tannic. Just a little kiss of sweetness in there near the finish. So drinkable I just want to gulp it but I must fight that so I can savor. Carbonation is fine, a little stinging carbonic acidity. Finish reminds of the old barn and straw notes from the nose. Theres one more thing in the aroma/flavor that I cant quite distinguish - seems like a spice of some sort (not that its spiced but just something funky and reminiscent of a spice, like cardamom or something. I just want to say more about this but mostly Im at a loss at this point. Its truly great though.

Bottle into a taster showing dark red with a finger of pink foam. 

The nose shows tart acetic notes with sweet notes of cherries. 

The palate is medium bodied and highly carbonated with a foamy mouthfeel. Highly tart with flavors dark cherries and a clean vanilla background with a slight white wine bitterness on the finish.

Pours a deep ruby colour with a dense shiny lasting pinkish head. Cherry nose, light almonds, crisp red apple, light citrus. The taste is lovely with rich fruit, sweet lingering cherry and a mineral tartness. Super ballance. Light sweet aftertaste leading to a crisp and drying finish. Very very good.

375ml bottle at Beerfox Riga. 2013. Pours clear ruby, big fluffy pink head stays. Aroma is wild dark cherries, fruity, nice sourness. Taste is nice sour cherry, some balsamico, acidy, woody, tannins, vinegar. Long aftertaste. Medium bodied, smooth carbo, perfect balance. Not that sour as I expected, but its just perfect next morning beer :)

375ml bottled 2015-05-13, 2014 harvest, so this bottle is almost 2 years old, stored in a controlled large beer cellar. Pour clear ruby red with a nice sparkling bubble foams. Aroma is of wild yeast, cherries and wood. Taste is from sweet acid fruits. Dry with a medium body and high carbonation. Long sweet cherry and wood finish.
UPDATED: JUN 21, 2017 Red color (more red then rose). Cherrys are noticeable but taste is dominantly sour and woody. Nice carbonation.
Kolor jasno-czerwony. Sporo wiśni, lekko słodki zapach. W smaku trochę drewna, gałęzie, lekko kwaśne i dzikie. Do tego wytrawne nuty z lekką goryczką przywodzącą na myśl pestki wiśni w posmaku.
Mooi bloedrood bier met volle babyroze schuimkraag. Zoet-zuur aroma en smaak. Kriek, kers, beetje azijn, vineus, eik. Kriek met een kick. Wijkt een beetje af van alle krieken maar wel lekker !!
Balance still strongly to the sour cherries part, still nice balance between malic and lactic acid, highly drinkable. Needs time for the funk, opened it too early (2015 bottle).
Bottle, 375 ml, 2015, from MBR, shared with JFK10000. Pours pinkish red with nice large pink head. Fruity, cherries, sour, horse blanket, some bitterness. Medium bodied. Nice one.
rocznik 2013. Z butelki po otwarciu buchnął potężny aromat migdałowy, są wiśnie i skóra. W smaku cierpki wiśniowy, migdałowy, troszkę skórki dobrego sera w posmaku. Za takie pieniądze to bajka :D

Color granate, opaco, con capa de espuma fucsia de tres dedos de grosor (retención decente). Carbonatación mínima y perfecta. Aroma ácido, a cereza. Sabor ácido, a cereza, entre champán y sidra. Retrogusto ácido persistente. Muy muy rica.

Botella 37.5 cl en cimmeria 26..12..2016. (r694). Año 2011. Color rojizo turbio con espuma blanca a rojiza. Aromas y sabores intensos y finos ácidos secos con ligeras maltas y cereales y un toque de frutos rojos y del bosque apreciable. Amargo suave final bien combinado con acidez y dulces de frutos rojos. Cuerpo medio seco y con gas. Bastante buena.

From bottle. Pours deep red with frothy head initially. Aroma isn't actually all that pleasant. Tastes of sour cherry and has that familiar lambic taste. Not as keen on this one as of other Krieks I've tasted

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap @Pułapka Gdańsk 
Aroma of cherries and red fruit, a bit or funky barnyard and some tracing vinegar. 
Pours clear cherry red with a reddish and a bit creamy head
Tart and very fruity taste, more a cherry wine than a beer

Very tasty and extremely fruity
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2017 Dark clear red with some pink head around the edges that persists. Aroma of mostly yeast, some fruit coming through. Taste is bitter and fruity at the start, and develops into sourness that lingers. Very tingly on the tongue! High ABV doesn?t stand out.

0.375 l bottle from EDEKA Mohr, 2013 harvest, bottled in July 2014, cellared for two years. Clear, ruby with a medium large, rather dense, slowly diminishing, pinkish white head. Slightly sweetish, sourish, vinous, a bit funky, dusty and very fruity aroma of sour cherries, wood, some barnyard and hints of almond. Moderately sour, very dry, rather fruity, vinous and slightly funky taste of sour cherries, lots of wood, some barnyard and a bit of barnyard, followed by a medium long, quite tart and very woody-dry finish. Medium body, moderately astringent and quite effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Delicious, well-balanced and very dry Kriek.
2013 год. Благоро& аромат зрелой не кислой вишни, тело хорошее плотное, вкус интерес& не экстрем& кислый
Wellicht moet ik kriekbier nog wat beter leren kennen, maar tot nu toe niet mijn favoriete biersoort. Deze is wel lekker fris en niet te zuur.

37,5cl-fles in les Zytholoog in Syntra te Kortrijk. U: Troebel dieprood met een roze schuimkraag die snel inzakt. G: Krieken, funky brett, hout en licht floraal. S: Rood fruit in de aanzet, daarna iets zolder-achtigs, hout en een stevig zurige afdronk. M: Volmondig met een stevige carbonatie.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
Red, pink head, bretty aroma, fun, cherries, caramel, excellent, sour flavor, bretty, cherries, caramelly, green tea, refreshing, fun, medium bodied.

375ml bottle [2009 vintage]. Cloudy, reddish brown colour with small, frothy, fairly lasting, pink head. Yeasty funky, earthy fruity, minimally vinous aroma, notes of cherry, morello, leather, lighter sherbet-like overtones, hints of blue grapes. Taste is dry, fruity, mild tartness, notes of morello, hints of plum, blue grapes; tart, sherbet-like overtones, hints of oak and leather. Round and balanced, unagressive, earthy.

F: red-pink, big, long lasting.
C: deep red, hazy, opaque.
A: woody, cherries, basement, brettanomyces, barnyard, horse blanket, leather, apple vinegar, complex. 
T: brettanomyces, barnyard, woody, cherries, dry on the palate, strong lactic tones, leather, tartness, medium body, good carbonation, very complex, good balanced and of course one from the masterpiece of this Style, vintage 2015 only, BB: 01/03/2036, 37,5cl bottle from Prik&Tik/Quali-drinks/ in Brussels.

750mL bottled 1995, drunk 10/8/16.Dark mix of black cherry and magenta hues with no head remaining.Lots of funky cherry notes, with pit and skin still very prominent, surprisingly. Pepper, cherry meat...very pie-like. Not a whole lot of brightness, though, with very minimal brett and even light on the lactic character. Lots of cellar quality, light green apple in the background...no alcohol noted. The site has it listed at 8% abv, but I dont recall what this bottle was listed at.Somewhat sweet, cherryish, initially. Notes of orange-cherry tea, more pie-like meatiness and sugar glaze. There is a lighthearted pepper, wood and spice character on the finish that is enjoyable, but its just rather bland and unexciting, with minimal lambic character. Carbonation is low, obviously, but whats there is quite loose and watery. Doesnt need to be a sour bomb, but it still needs more balance and more dryness.

Light cherry colour, clear. Floral and funky aroma with a subtle injection of cherries and hints of spice and caramel. Bone dry with a touch of raspberry-like tartness, high carbonation, nice frothy texture. Brilliant!
1995 Bottle Grana Padano Share- pours brown - nose/taste of cherry pit, dirty earth, light vinegar tartness - medium body
Alone at home. Dark pink colored beer with medium pinkish head and lots of carbonation. Fruited sour aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is sour cherry fruited. Nice one.

Bottle from 2008. The aroma has cherries, almonds/cherry pits, dusty and earthy tones. Red coloured beer with a medium, pink head. The taste is light-moderate sour, very fruity, oaky. For its ABV, quite dry and probably a bit thin. Nice, this one is.

37,5 cl bottle, vintage 2014. Served in flute glass. Poured murky dark red with a one finger frothy pink head. Lively carbonation in glass. Aroma: cherries, tart, barnyard, granny smith apples, vinegar, musty basement. Taste: Cherries, tart & sour, barnyard, vanilla, oak, vinous, granny smith apples, vinegar, musty, citric. Delicious kriek. Just Lambic and cherries here! Nice balance between sweet and sour. Medium body with a long dry and sour finish with a hint of sweetness from the cherries. An absolutely delicious and refreshing Kriek. A true work of art...

Bottle. Hazy dark reddish pour with small red head. Aroma is fresh with cherries, rasins on sweet sour base. Taste is very balanced with light sweetness and a good sour kick. Medium carbonation. Light body

0,375l bottle at home. Vintage 2014. BB 13.05.2035. dark redish hazy color, small pinkish head. smells of cherries, heavy funky, barnyard, green apples, lightly citric, quite musty. very nice smell. medium to full body, medium carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes rather funky, barnyard, light cherries, some green apples, quite nutty, citric, musty, cherry jam, lightly sour. finishes quite dry and lightly sour with notes of cherries, cherry jam and some musty notes. overall very nice one, loved the smell, tastes is rather heavy, quite funky, I miss a bit more sourness, but overall great stuff.
[backlog] 25-06-16 // bottle at home. Pours a dark red colour, almost no head. Nice sour cherry aroma. Well balanced. Excellent Kriek.

Stumbled across a 2014 bottle while meandering back to the hostel in Belgium. Wow this was a terrific nightcap. Beautiful Ruby pour with nice pink head. Tart cherry pie through and through. Limbic sour and acidity. But with just the PERFECT sour cherry notes. This is how a kriek should taste
Bottle at the wedding between finol and malin_aiisa! Pours red with almost no head. Really nice Classic kriek

From Freistädter shop, 2013; dark red with small pink head; aroma is very citric, hay, cherry; taste is cherry, citric, low sourness, slightly funky dry finish, some spicy alkohol like notes; fizzy carbonation

At the MBR Sour Beer tasting. Thanks to whoever brought it! 15 vintage. Misty red body. Lightly swetish marzipan and cherry aroma. Very much sour taste, slightly spicy cherry dry taste, but unbalanced in its sourness. This needs more years on it I guess. Right now, its not that impressive, though far from bad.

07.09.2016, 37,5 cl bottle, vintage 2014. Served in tulip. Pours beautiful ruby with a pink head. Aromas: barnyard, cherry, wood, brett. Not very acidic, but with dry taste and aftertaste with just hints of sweetness and cherry flavors. The brett is strong in this one? Remember other vintages as less dull.

Dark transparent red with small pink head. Aroma yeast and cherries. Medium body, moderately carbonated. Sweet and sour cherry flavor, leaning toward the sweet side, some yeast/bread in the background. Not my favorite style but this one was rather enjoyable.

Bottle (2012) @ home. Rosso rubino, quasi violacea, con schiuma rosa fine, ma che scompare rapidamente. Aroma intenso fine e complesso.Frutti rossi, amarene, pelle di salame, citrico, scorza di lime, legno, vaniglia zucchero filato, cantina/polvere. Gusto amabile, acido, senza compromessi, fruttato, acido lattico, per nulla amara. vaniglia, zucchero filato e luppolo vecchio sono i gusti secondari. Poco corposa, debole, calda, decisamente carbonata, molto spigolosa. astringente, ma equilibrata ed armonica.

- schöne undurchdringliche rote Farbe mit leichter Schaumbildung
- durchdringende säuerliche Kirscharomen mit einem leichten
 Holztouch
- Kohlensäure perfekt zum Bier passend dosiert
- geschmacklich kitzelt die Säure richtig auf der Zunge 
- die Kirschnote wird nie aufdringlich süß bzw. die Fassnote
 nie muffig oder stark holzig
- im Abgang bleibt alles harmonisch im Einklang und hinterlässt 
 einfach eine fantastische Note
Fazit: Das Kirschbier schlechthin, besser kann man es eigentlich
nicht machen
Bottle 0,375. 2015. Pours dark ruby red with redish white head. Excellent beer. Cherry, tart, rhubarb, dry finish. Medium body, lively carbonation.

Aussergewöhnlich, da hier ein extravagantes und überaus geschmacksintensives Fruchtsauerbier der ledrig funkigen Art präsentiert wird. Rund & kantig. Schmeichelnd & widerspenstig. Ein wundervolles belgisches Biest. Flasche 375ml von VAN ERP on Groningen. 5,60.

Dégustée à température de 12,2°C à 14,8°C. Corps grenat à reflets acajou, trouble, couronné dune mousse rose pâle à reflets violet, très épaisse, crépitante, qui retombe progressivement. Arômes de cerise aigre et de bois. Tranchante et sèche, fruitée et boisée; amertume prononcée qui donne de la longueur; pas sucrée du tout; très bien sur un sorbet cassis pour constituer un beau dessert digestif. Rustique et élégante, assez exigeante.

375ml bottle at home. Dark purple with a medium pinkish head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Quite sweet with nice sour tones. Sour cherries, tart, rhubarb, wood and some acidic tones. Good stuff.

0.375 bottle.   Very dark red color with a medium, pink head of average retention. Aroma of cherries, some cedar wood, and perhaps a bit of brett. Taste is sweet and sour with obvious cherry predominance, though other tones are featured as well such as malts and pickled cucumbers. A medium body, a slick texture, and a fizzy carbonation. Finish is medium long and does not seem to introduce anything new. Overall, the beer is good, a greatly refreshing brew.

Dark red with pinky small head. In aroma there is plenty of funk, wet leather and some dark cherries. In taste dark cherries, leather with tartness by the end and moderate sourness. On palate moderate-high carbonation, dry.
2011 bottle. Dark purple with a pink head. Cherry, tart, sour and funky. Basement, cherry, funk, dry, acidic, light yeast, great finish.
Peccato perchè secondo me non era a temperatura perfetta, però nonostante questa pecca, è davvero meravigliosa, al palato è fantastica...

Bottle. Pickle juice and tons of sour cherry aroma with some sweet fruit accents. Hazy dark red under a thin, pink sheet. Very sour cherry and sweet pilsner malt, with a little pickle juice and bitter fruit pit. Medium body, mouth puckering juicy, high carbonation. Fairly ethanolic.

375ml cork and cage bottle at home in Richmond as Boon Kriek Mariage Parfait, 8%, 2013 vintage BB 2034, so aged 2 years in bottle. Very dark red, pretty much opaque in this light, dense foamy pink head. Aroma is chlorinated swimming pool, cherry stone, strawberry boiled sweet found down the side of an old sofa, cat litter. Simple cherry juice and also musty lambic stuff. Body is a little frothy, low carbonation. Taste is cherry sweets, rhubarb jam, some light lemon, touch of red wine, perfumey notes. Not particularly sour or tart, but obviously has those aspects.  Deep rounded fruitiness and, importantly, not too sweet. For the style, drinkability is high. Excellent, as expected.

Bottle at home. Pours a hazy reddish purple color with a small pinkish head. The aroma and flavor have tart cherries, some sweetness, tart citrus, funk, wood, earthy, dry, some acidity, interesting mix, nose is a bit better than the flavor, though still good.

375 ml bottle I picked up from the Thirsty Quaker a while back. 2014 date on the bottle, best before end of 2033, so I snuck it in with just over a decades and a half to spare. Purple-red color with a creamy, sheeting, pink head. Tart cherry juice aroma. Bit of wood and spice. Fairly acetic, tart, and also kinda sweet. Soft mouthfeel, that gets more lively and tart as it needs the finish. Well executed.
Sample from a bottle. Reddish colour with a pink head. Aroma and flavour of cherries, acidic, oak and sourness.

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2016 37,5cl 2014 Vintage shared when Belgium was still a promise in the EUCup. - Makes a lot of sense as a bonedry, amped Kriek Lambiek featuring cherry stone, skins and quenching brett-thinned wheat in equal doses. Acidity remains tied in to the beer thin oaken body, feels like a crisp wood chip splinter of that cherry infused foeder on the tongue. Horsey aromas remain well-mannered, orchard like. Not a whole lot of cherry juiciness, all fruit turned into bone dry lambiek here. High-class summer sipper to revisit regularly.

Bottle at home. 2014 vintage enjoyed in juli 2016. Aroma is tart and slightly sweetish cherries, barnyard funk, oak. Flavour is moderate to medium sour and light sweet with a bone dry finish. Good complex funk and oak, lots of cherries. Though not as sour as I like my Kriek, this is an excellent specimen.

Bottke at Home. Pours red with a small pinkish head. Aroma of cherries, light vinegar, light acedic, light barn, a whiff old Honey, light cherrystones. Taste is rather tart, with mellow cherries, a tad of barn and small scent off which stays for a while in the aftertaste. Dry and quite well balanced not too sour.

Prostě tohle miluju, ádný přeslazený kriek pro masy, prostě přírodní, relativně výrazně prkvaený s vysokým ne příli výrazným alkoholem v chuti. Něco co nejde nalít kadému, ale úasně se snoubí klasická chuť spontálně kvaeného pivka s viňovou ovocnou kyselinkou. Prostě něco co bych mohl stále. Lahvinka padla u pěkné kníky a úasný večer byl dokonalí.

37cl bottle at home. Dark ruby, clear, with a tall pink head with good retention. All sorts of cherries in the taste notes (macerated cherries, cherry preserve, slightly unripe cherries) on top of a light lambic funk layer. Light body, high carbonation and a sour-sweet aftertaste.

Bouteille de 375ml, indiquant Récolte 2014. Une mousse crémeuse rosée se forme sur un liquide rougeâtre translucide. Le côté fruité typique des kriek ressort au nez. Son côté acidulé sajoute à la combine, nous donnant un produit de haute qualité.
Light bodied with a tart finish. Notes of cherry and almond. Slight sweetness up front. Deep pink color with a fizzy head.
Bottle @ home. Aroma of brett, cherry and marzipan. Clear red colour with no head. Taste is light sweet, moderate- sour and light bitter. Light+ body, dry feel, sour cherry finish.

Draft to tulip
Consummation: I love gueuzes and hope to be able to spell them too. This, of course is fucking awesome. Farmhouse, lemony sour, yeasty plum. 
Adjunct: Horse blanket, orange peel; cloudy light amber, thin ringed head
How: bottle Appearance: ruby red with a medium to small pinkish head. Aroma: cherries, marzipan, floral, hay. Palate: medium body, lively carbonation.

2013 vintage bottle. Dark red colour with a tiny pink head. Aroma is full of cherries with skin, light funk, marzipan and oak. Light to medium sour with flavour of cherry, oak, almond, marzipan, hints of alcohol. Dry finish full of cherries. Really a smooth Kriek thats not as sour as likes of Cantillon. Hides the ABV in a really smooth manner.
Bottle @ CBC2016. Pours deep dark red with a small pink head. Notes of cherries, light funk, hay, almonds, marzipan.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2015 One of the greats among old krieks, with malse lambic and a higher ABV - and higher cherry dosis than is customary. Re-rating based on a 2 year old bottle; this was actually the first traditional lambic beer I ever had, many years ago, when I had no experience with them whatsoever so it is about time to revisit it.  Quite some pressure on the bottle upon removing the cork.  Remarkably thick, regular, dense and moussy, off-pink head, colour is a beautifully deep bright ruby red, a tad darker than usual for the style (probably a combination of the above average amount of cherries on the one hand and the above average ABV for the style on the other hand).  Rich and appetizing aroma of macerated cherries of course, but also blueberry, blackberry and strawberry, sour yoghurt, some wood, old sherry, wet leather, more subtle hints of the rosy smell of fresh menure (but in a good way, this is lambic!), horse stable, yellow passion fruit - in all, the delightful fruit overload is shown off to a much greater extent than the lambic funkiness, and this is exactly how Frank Boon intended it to be.  Crisp, estery, sour onset, a little bit puckering even with a lemony edge, but mostly a ton of sour cherries and all kinds of red and dark berries, even a little bit sweet in an otherwise sour context; champagne-like, refined carbonation adds liveliness just the way it should be.  Softer lactic acidity takes over and the deep soapy wheat and bready barley structure supports a conveyor belt of rich, juicy fruitiness right down to the finish, where everything comes together in a perfectly balanced manner: the sugars of the fruit (even a bit strawberry-like), the grain bill, the wild fermentation effects with leathery, hayish and yoghurt-like retronasal effects, a hint of drying woodiness but not as much as usual in this style, a very subtle hint of earthy hops but not interfering with all this fruit lambic complexity, and even some warming, liqueurish alcohol far away in the background, very pleasing.  I remember how shocked I was by its acidity the first time I tasted this without any experience, but in retrospect, this is actually a soft, malse cherry lambic, elegant yet lush and thick, a true masterpiece in the league of traditional fruit lambics.  However subtle and graceful it may be, it has a personality of its own.  Highly recommendable if you are after richness combined with subtlety and balance.

Pours out of the bottle in a deep dark red colour with rosé head and medium body. Aroma of cherry kernels, leaves and cherries. Taste of morello cherries, cherry stones, leaves and sour cherries. Wonderful and smooth to drink, very high quaffable and delicious. Loved it.

375 ml corked and caged bottle. Pours deep red with a minimal light pinkish head. Nose has cherries, almonds and light funk. Taste is wonderful with a light funk, tons of ripe cherries, marzipan, almonds and some raspberry.
37cl bottle. Pours deep murky red with a big rose head. Sour cherry aroma. Flavor is well balanced with a light to moderate sourness and notes of cherries and wood.

Bottle at the Syb Pig in Boca Raton. Pinkish-red pour with a pink head. Beautiful color. Aroma starts with sour cherries, oak barrel, slight vinegar, sour apples and grapes as well as wild yeasts. Taste is close to the same with the cherries most dominant. Very sour, not a sweet fruit beer. Thin body, heavy carbonation. Finish is tart and delicious. Slightly dry ending. Very good.

2012. A purple-red beer with a big and pink head. The nose is sour, natural cherries, some grapes and lether. Taste is strongly sour, lots of cherries, some vinegar and lether. Medium bodied, high carbonation that is sparkling but smooth. Very tastefull, balanced sourness and naturall cherries.
Oh buddy green bottle cherry very merry, marriage not divorce, ruby sour, max power. True definition style profile, great job!

Bottle 0.375l. Pours deep red with pink head. Aroma is full of cherries, tart, wood. Taste is sour but with a very well balanced cherry sweetness and fruitiness, hints of wood. Aftertaste is sour with some bitterness, medium carbonation. Very drinkable Lambic, not ultra sour and tart but more on the sweeter side.

Bottle - Vintage 2011 - Cherries and oak with just a slight acetone note. Cloudy ruby with a thin bubbly pink head. Tart cherry, nice rich oak notes but again with an acetone note. Overall, quite nice event with the acetone.

Sample from bottle, CBF 2014. Deep red colour with a dense, pink head. Fruity aroma with tart cherries, caramel malts, vanilla, oak, yeasts, barnyard, some earthy hops. Taste is light sour. Medium body with a lively carbonation. Finishes dry and fruity with tart cherries, fruits, yeasts and marzipan that chases most acidic notes away. Albeit a bit on the sweeter side, a very enjoyable Lambic.

Bottle, 2008 vintage. Pours a deep ruby port color with almost no head. Aroma is deep and rich: red wine, musty cork, oak, cherry skins, plum, appetizing tartness. Oak and barrel character is especially pronounced. Taste is prominent sour cherry and grape skin tannins with a hint of balsamic, oak, and an almost Sour Patch-like sweet-tart quality. Really good.
Corked 37.5 cl bottle @ home. Pours red with a pink head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are cherries, tartness, oak - with a tart finish.
Roze bier met schuim. Smaak is typisch voor Lambik, droog en zuur en niet zoet. Krieksmaak is duidelijk aanwezig.

Bottled from Burg Bieren, 2011 harvest, BB 13 07 2032, large sample, served in a chouffe glass. Initially clear ruby color, big frothy pink head, diminishing to a firm medium lasting head. Aroma of cherry, marzipan, some horseblanket and barnyard, some oak wood. Quite sour in taste, slight fruity sweetness. Mostly citric acid and some lactic acid. Some nutty cherry pits in flavor as well. Quite full bodied, high on carbonation but not in a too disturbing way. Slight alcohol noticeable and slight dry in the finish. Quite heavy on the stomach, but still a lovely brew, although I prefer still (fruit)lambic instead of carbonated stuff.

37.5 cL bottle at home, 2012 crop. Pours hazy red with a large pink head. Aroma is a bit sweet with lots of cherries, some syrup, some tartness and barnyard. Taste has some barnyard and a soft sourness with cherries, red fruits, some wood and barnyard, finish is slightly dry. Medium body and carbo. Quite nice.

Color rubí, algo turbio, con espuma rosada de excelente apariencia y durabilidad. Aromsa de brett. y madera, con toques afrutados, sobre todo ácidos. Cuerpo medio-alto, inicio fresco, dulce y afrutado, que pasa a un final muy seco de excelente contraste. Muy rica.
Dark red colour. Sour cherry aroma, flavour is tart, cherries, oak, slightly sweet

10/IV/14 - 37.5cl bottle from??? @ home - BB: n/a, 2008 vintage (2014-358) 
Little cloudy deep dark ruby red beer, big pink aery head, pretty stable, non adhesive. Aroma: lots of cork, some marzipan, soft fruitiness, bit funky. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: sour start, fruity cherries, mouldy cork, very bitter, lemon rind, citric acidity. Aftertaste: pretty sour, lemony, bitter hops, moulded cork, some bitter almonds, vinegar. Talk about a disappointment. :( I guess it had a bad cork? Should re-rate, I guess.
UPDATED: MAY 23, 2014 Cassis kleur met wat schuim. Aroma van kersen, wat zuur. Smaak is mild zuur met kersen. Mooie kriek

2012. Deep dark red with dark pink head. Great funky maltiness, quite spicy, sour red fruits, some vanilla woodyness and light yoghurt. Medium sour going into more intense sour finish, not much sweetness. Very nice medium bodied with prickly carbonation. Not the best kriek but very enjoyable.

Bottle from Quarrie. Perfect looking beer! Nose is full of sweet tart - bright cherries and sweet raspberry, almost beetroot juice in there with a pleasing tang to it. A hint of sugar coming through in the taste but overall it is very clean and has a creamy cherry icing feel to the finish with plenty of tarty berries and sweet raspberry juice. Good balance between tart and sweetness which some krieks really struggle to pull of. Nice beer

Bottle from mane liquor. Pours a cherry red colour with a pinky foamy head. Funky looking beer! Nose is cherries, oak, tart and citrus. Taste is quite sour upfront with focus on the sour cherries. Nice acidity to it. Love how the oaky vanilla smooths it out at the end. Fucking winner for me

Bottle shared wit father in law, 2008 version. Dark ruby color with small pink head that dissapear quickly. Smells sour cherries. Tastes cherries offcourse and sweeter than it smells but it stings at the back of the tounge at the end. Long lasting nice finish. Very dry.
Bottle. Pours deep ruby with a pink head, some retention/lace. Aroma of cherry, funk, oak, dust. Taste is tart, lactic, cherry, oak, dust. Palate is soft, slick, tart finish.

Bottle. 8.0%. Vintage 2008. Best before 28.10.30. Pours a murky dark burgundy with a diminishing pink head. Tart/sour, but smooth aroma, with a cherry note, horse blanket and a hint of pineapple. A more general berry-note as it warms. Well-balanced. Flavour is tart/sour, with cherry and pineapple. Bitter and sour finish with pineapple and a touch of coconut. Lingering dryness and a light apple note. Overall pretty good; well-balanced, and the tart-/sourness isnt too intrusive. The cherry isnt that outspoken, but I think it might have been cloying if that had been the case; the subdued cherry notes makes for a more balanced brew. The pineapple and coconut notes were a bit of a surprise though  but not bad. 07.03.14.

Pours a dark burgundy with a medium pink head that adheres quite readily to the glass and provide really nice lacing. Nose is of cherry meat and pits, not too abrasive with acidity. Taste is of cherries and really light funk, really classy. Tart but not overdone. Mouthfeel is lean, carbonation medium. A top tier kriek for sure, yum!
Bottle at home. Deep red pour, fizzy pink head. Tart cherry aroma. High carbonation. Slightly sweet, tart cherry taste. Carbonation is a bit to high in my opinion, but still a really tasty beer.

Bouteille 375ml, 2011 gracieuseté de BlogueDeBieres, Merci! Couleur rouge tirant sur le pourpre, mousse rose foncée presque rouge laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme terreux, brett, cerise subtile, boisé, champignon, bonbon à la cerise. Goût de cerise sûrette, un peu sucré, acidité moyenne, boisé, cuir en arrière-goût. Carbonatation moyenne, corps moyen.
Dark red colour, some pink foam. Medium carbonation. Very fruity oude Kriek. Sour taste with sweet notes. Some light bitterness in the finish. Also a bit dry. Easy drinkable.

Bottle at home (2012). Pours dark ruby red with a large pink head that quickly disappears. Sour aroma of cherries and earthy wood. Sweet cherrie taste with a nice long sour aftertaste. Quite good, but apparently even better when aged.

2009 bottle courtesy of the slovak sniper.
Dark,ruby pour, with a big thick pink head. Huge aroma of vinegar, funk, wet hay and tart, sour cherries. Pefrect carb and mouth feel. Finish is not as tart and sour as you might expect, but its still very nice. Loads of cherries and funk. The alcohol is nowhere to be found. Great stuff.

Small corked bottle, 2011 on the neck. Burgundy body with a medium pink head. Aroma has tart cherries and some light funk. Medium sweet and tart taste with lots of cherries indeed. And some cranberry. Not as acidic as I feared it would be but on the other hand not notably complex either. Alcohol is totally covered. Im not ashamed to admit that I like sweetened Lambics just as much and on some occasions even more.
Clear light amber colour. Fairly tame aroma, horsey and slightly perfumey. Rich flavor with hints of raisin and a bitter finish.

Bottle. Reddish colour with a off-white head that quickly dissapears. Aroma is very fruity with notes of cherries. Flavor is slightly sweet with light acidic notes, dominates the fruity notes instead the acidic ones. Light acidic final with fruity notes.
Dark red bosy small pinkish head. Aroma has sorbus and some woody leather. Flavour has sour cassis and cherries. Smooth palate. Nice.
Pours dark ruby red with a small white lace. Aroma is tart cherries and bready grains. Taste is sour, tart cherry with a slight yeast lacing on the tongue. Quite nice.
Pours in red body with no head at all. Aroma is cherry, very tard, dark sugar notes. Very sweet with no bitterness. Body is light with light carbonation as well. Average.

Bottle. 2011 version. Dense red with a frothy pink head. Aroma has tart cherries, hay, oak, earthy. Taste is light tart cherries up front with an increasing acidity, cherries comes through in the end. Light body with a lively small bubble carbonation.

Bottled. Pours red amber with a medium lancing, off-white pinkish head. Aroma of cherry, wood, earth and funky notes. Sweet flavor that ends up acidic and bitter. Medium bodied, watery text. and soft carb. An excellent brew.

375 ml bottle. L0301. BB 28/10/2030. Courtesy of Brandman. 
Dark hazy red colour with a small pinkish white head.
Redcurrant, berries, leather, heavy tartness and mild sourness in the strong aroma. 
The flavour is tart red berries, some sourness and mild vinegar.

Drank this one with Thanksgiving dinner this year.

08 375ml bottle.


A - Pours ruby red with a fizzy half finger tall white head, dissipating down to nothing at all, leaving no lace at all down the glass. Much like the geuze, it went totally flat within minutes.


S - Smells of ripe sour cherries, damp earth, basement must, bit of barnyard funk, lactic sourness, oak and some wet grass. Not as earthy as the geuze thanks to the addition of the cherries but it still just doesnt jump out at me like others in the style.


T - Starts off with the sour cherries quickly giving way to a mix of sharp lactic sourness, musty funk, grass and a touch of sweetness help round it all together. Finish is quite dry, lingering long after the finish. Liking how much the cherries come through here compared to the nose.


M - Medium body with spritzy carbonation. While the geuze was more tart this is a bit more sour, still has plenty of dryness after each sip. 


O - I enjoyed this one a bit more than the geuze but it still wasnt worth what I had to pay for them. I think their are better examples of the style but if the price was right I would definitely pick up another bottle.
2009. très bonne version là aussi, qui ne demande quà vieillir encore. Bien meilleure que la version "Boon Kriek" classique (14/20), grosse acidité, goût de cerise très persistant.
Wonderful. Never too sweet, but also not sour. Nicely balanced, nice aroma. Served in a huge round glass at tje 12 Balcken.
Fles bij 12 balcken op Texel. Geserveerd in een verkeerd glas. Prachtig dieprode kleur. Zurig met lange afdronk. Prettig mondgevoel.

Bottle 2011
Aroma is cherries, acid, chemical.
Pours dark red, purple pinkish head, immediately gone.
Sweet sour taste, something plastic, cherries, nuts?.
Chemical fruity finish.

375 bottle, 2011 harvest, dark ruby color, with a red-pinkyish head, with a mild funky, bretty wild yeast, horse blanket, branyard, musty fruit, woody nose, with a light dry sour, tart red cherry, acidic note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a good mild sour, tart, winey dark red acidic cherry, bretty, funkiness yeast character, with some woody red wine tannin, juicy red berry, marzipan almondy flavours, leading towards a funky, bretty wild yeast, wild dark sour fruity cherry, tart, sourness finish.

Bottle (thanks to goodbyeohio)... Poured deep red with a pink-ish head. Nice tart cherry aroma. Nice acidity and tartness with a fresh cherry flavor. Dark cherry skins and sweetness helped balance oak and tartness with mild funk. Really nice drinking lambic. Pretty awesome, actually.

Bottle at a local bottle share, pours a dark red with a light pink head, the aroma has quite a bit of funk and sourness on the nose, the flavor is really funky and fruity on the front end, some vinegar like notes in the finish, the cherries are really nice and not overpowering on this one, nice.
Bottle at Nuetnigenough. Deep red colour, pink head. Intense sour cherries aroma. Very much sour cherries throughout, hintd of almonds. A good kriek that maybe lacks that little extra.

Appearance: Hazy red color with a pinkish head that leaves a ok lacing.Aroma: Sour and tart cherries.Palate: Medium body. Sour/acidic and a balanced bitterness. Average carbonation.Taste: Sour and balanced acidic cherries. A bit dry texture.Overall impression: Tasty and lovel with some cheese.Personal stats: Bottle from Berts Bierhuis in Utrech, Netherlands.

Bottle. Pours pinkish with a light pink head. Aroma is cherries, raspberries, funk, sour and some barnyard. Taste is a bit tart, medium sweet. Finish is nice sour and tart. Fruity. Medium body with average carbonation.
Odeur franche de cerise, couleur conséquente, goût sûr avec sucre léger. Peu de co2, rafraichissant, un peu astringent.
Very good beer. Intense and full taste of lambiek and real natural cherries.

Bottle, from the ever-so-generous Engelsmann (THANKS!), at home. Pours a clearish, dark red with a nice pink head. Sour with some sweetness. Aromas of a mix of sour- and sweet cherries. Also light aromas of almonds and hints of vinegar. Medium bodied. Medium carbonation. Dry finish with more sour cherries.

375ml bottle. Sour, cherries aromas. Pours red, with nce reddish head, vanishing, some lacing. Light body, average carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is sour, sour and sour. Cherries. More sour. Enjoyable.

Had this in a bottle in a nice bar in Gainesville FL. I wasnt expecting much on the sour side of the street, being a University town and all ... clearly I was wrong. Heck, they had the Lindemanns kriek on tap. To this beer ... nice color, beautiful aroma of barnyard funk and fruit as soon as the bottle was opened ... before I even poured out the beer. Great balance on the acidity, beautiful austere cherry taste ... just a fabulous kriek. Whenever I see this in a store Im buying a case.

375ml bottle from IPB.
Appearance : Deep red with pink medium foamy head. Awesome look.

Aroma : Deep rich cherries with nice funk. Citrusy tartness with some acidity. slightly earthy. Lovely tartness. Light cough syrup. Cherries are slightly sweet but nothing close to artificially sweetened krieks.

Taste : Sharp and acidic cherries. Light funk. Finish is tart and sharp with light cough syrup. Light funk and raspberry leaves on the late finish. Light astringency on the arrival.

Palate : Lively carbonation. Thin palate. Rather dry but a tad sweeter than most good examples of the style.

Overall : Fairly nice kriek. Big and bold cherries aroma. The cherries are less expressive on taste than nose. Taste has some kind of cherry pit astringency.
Wonderful oaked and cherry aroma along with slight sourness. Flavor is mellow and a bit muddled. Alcohol nowhere. Great beer.

How: Draught.
Where: De Bierboom, Brugge.
Appearance: Red colour with a small pink head.
Aroma: Acidic cherry, tart.
Body: Medium body, nice carbonation.
Flavour: Sweet cherry, a bit bitter.
Comment: Well balanced.

Bottle: Poured a deep red color lambic with a nice large pink foamy head with good retention and some good lacing. Aroma of sour and tart cherries notes is quite enticing. Taste is a wonderful mix between some tart cherries with some oak and light funky notes with lightly sweet finish and almost no acidity. Body is full with great carbonation. Wonderful interpretation of the style with great restraint on the acidity level.

2011 testad 2013. Tät lila rödaktig. Doften har initialt mycket funk för att sedan övergå till att domineras av körsbär och mosad bigarrå. Riktigt härlig doft. Ganska frisk även. Halv cm rosa skum som håller sig kvar elegant. Inte det minsta syntetiska inslag som så ofta kan förekomma hos vissa kriek. Kan säkert nå magiska nivåer med lite lagring. Delar med en som dricker kriek för första gången och som gör ganska imponerande analyser.
Sampled at a recent tasting. 08 vintage. Nice big aroma of stinky fruit. Slight tart and sour, just what the doctor ordered. I dug it.

pours ruby red with thin pink red head,aroma sour cherry faint almond,taste is almost pure sour cherry acidic but not as acidic as other krieks,dry sour finish that lasts,this was bottled in 2011,overall a very fine example of traditional krieks

Bottled 2009: Very very dark ruby purple color with a light pink head. Aroma is mostly cherry, leather and wet basement, and still pleasantly floral. Flavor is strong, tart cherries with a sweet creamy finish like frozen yogurt. Crisp and clean, medium mouthfeel with mild carbonation. Really good- will buy again

Quite a nice lambic. Ill be the first to admit that it isnt my favorite beer style, however with this one you get something pretty complex. More like a dry champagne than a beer, but the sour bubbly fruit notes are quite nice. This was a 2011 vintage and I was amazed that the bottle said it could be stored until 2032! Worth trying once.

Bottle at JFs, cheers to James, 19/07/13.
Lightly hazed cherry red with a medium sized crimson head that retains well.
Nose is burnt cherry dipped straw, soured cherry drops.
Taste comprises tarte cherries, light smoke, straw, burnt grass, damp cherry sherbet.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, refreshing cherry finish.
Decent.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottled. Poured rich, deepet garnet with a dusting of pink-tinted head. The aroma picked up rich chery meat and a bit of leather topped by cherry vinegar and woody notes.. more funky as it warmed.. really nice. The flavor found tart cherry skins, vinegar, and oak on the tip of the tongue.. pale malt and a bit of cherry meat supported.. finished sour and funky with lots of acidity. Medium-bodied with just the right carbonation.. very sour and bracing at times.. very lovely and well-balanced overall.

Im more of a gueuze man that kriek man.. A preference i think i share with Frank Boon as he makes much better gueuze than Kriek in my opinion. A corked and caged 37.5 bottle, 2011 vintage poured into my trusty ZBF 15cl tasting glass. My bottle pours pretty flat, deep red colour makes it look like a red wine.. a light chilled one. It could be me or it could be bottle but the aroma doesnt jump out at me as per other old krieks. Taste is sharp, bitter and very nice indeed, but by no means the best of Boon.
Ruby red body; fizzy pink head. Super sharp aroma, acidic, fruity. Awesome kriek. Intense, fruity, acidic, very slightly bitter.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2015 2008 bottle. Deep dark red with a medium pink head. Aroma is funk, cheese, acidity, cherries, cherry candy. Taste is cherries, cherry jam/cherry pie filling, with the right amount of cheesiness and funk. Finish is sour and dry. Medium body, a ton of carbonation (a little too much). This is a really good kriek.

375ml Bottle - A rich red in colour. Cherry, blackcurrant, almonds and some musty hints in the aroma. Fruity, tangy, sweet and tart taste with rich notes of cherries, strawberry jam and almonds. A class act.

37,5cl bottle. 2011.
APPEARANCE: deep red beer, stable red head.
NOSE: sourness very prominent, lots of cherries, wood, some horse blanket.
TASTE: very intense cherry taste, sourness is there, but not at all overruling the sweetness, its very good balanced. Some alcohol noticeable though.
Very good beer!

Beautiful dark red body with a dark pink head. Excellent strong, sour cherry aroma with a nice strong acidity. Full body with plenty of carbonation. Delicious, quite sour flavour with sour cherries, a hint of green apple. Really great.
Cherry red pour with pink head. Aroma is flat sour cherries. Sour cherry with a sweet note. Acidic and flavorful. Medium/light body with good carbonation. Nice beer no hint of the 8%.

Clear dark ruby red with small redish foam head. Aroma is sour cherry, taste is sour with cherry flavor and some banana far away. Nice beer for a change in tone, away from the usual. (Velp 201306)

375ml bottle.  2008.  Murky thick purple red body.  Thinnish, glass rimming head.  Boldly sour, more so than I remember the last few bottles over the last few years being.  One of my favorite Krieks, I fear the hoarders might have bought these all up in WI now.  Vinous, with a big enough body to really make it an ideal sipper.  I almost get some fruity pulp tastes, deep blackberry, cherry, plum.  Fantastic beer.

dark ruby colour, with long lasting half centimeter pinkish-ruby head; aroma of not syrup-like cherry, and notable presence of lambic-background - wine cellar, oak barrel and sourness;taste is fully dominated by sournes of cherry and the lambic itself; in contrast with other fruit lambics and krieks, it has no sweetness at all, but the lambic-basis can also be felt very clearly; such like a a boon gueuze with the sourish essence of cherry; marvellous lambic.

37.5 cl.  Vintage 2011.  Meilleure avant le 13 juillet 2032.  Une robe rouge qui frôle le sublime et une mince couche mousseuse rose comme une fleur dans les cheveux dune déesse.  Des parfums boisés, de poussière et de cave humide, damandes et de cerises, de groseilles, de framboises.  Des saveurs sèches et explosives de fruits rouges.  Une flore microbienne, des bactéries et un éclair de génie.  Des saveurs aigres et surettes, terreuses et incroyablement représentées.   Une bouche immense, richement construite, débordante et débilitante.  Une finale rouge, fruitée et extrêmement sèche et superbement balancée.  Tout près du chef duvre.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2013 Récolte 2011, bouteille de 375ml avec bouchon de liège. Belle robe rouge avec une mousse rose qui est crémeuse au début mais qui se désagrège rapidement. Un nez parfait de kriek avec des notes de vin de cerise, raisin, un côté acide présent mais jamais désagréable. La bouche est parfaite bue chambré, les cerises sont au rendez-vous. Lacidité est contrastée par des notes fruitées qui donnent limpression dêtre sucrée. La finale sur les cerises augmente le plaisir et commande la main de prendre une autre gorgée.

0,375l bottle from Csakajósör, Budapest. Hazy, deep red colored with little, dark pink head. Soury, dry, cherry odor. The aroma is like the odor: sour, fruity. The fruit aroma is very delicious. Not that syrupy cherry feeling like some other krieks, but the real cherry flavour with the soury lambic aroma. Very delicious. The taste is dry and fresh. Creamy texture, medium bodied, average carbonation. Dry, cherry finish. Very good beer. Both the lambic and fruity flavours can be found. Moderated, milder than pure sour ales, but very typical.

Bottle generously shared by Sparky!  08 vintage.  Violet pour with some crimson, scarlet, and ruby red edges.  Plum skin, tart cherry, balsamic, cheese, and funk.  Quite fruity and mildly acidic.  Not the punch in the throat you get with other sours.  Best of the night.

Purple color with pink head. Aroma of white wine vinegar, cherries, cheese, basement aromas. Taste is medium sour ,fruity and metallic flavor. Light body, thin texture, lively carbonation and dry finish. A bit weird. 2011 Vintage
Loved this beer from top to bottom. Sour and fruit heaven. Discovered it at a festival and will be seeking more out

2009 Vintage. 375mL bottle at Grote Dorst, pours an opaque dark pink with a medium potent pink head. Aroma of potent cherries (despite the age), and some slight tartness and acidity, but not much. Flavour brings out insanely potent cherries, not much else -- not much tartness, not sweetness. The cherries are incredibly potent, imparting intense cherry flavours despite 4 years of age on this beer. An absolutely wonderful kriek.

pours cloudy pink-purplish with a nice purple head, some retention. plastered cherries, sweet ripened cherries, other red fruitiness, soap and funk. aroma is not necessarily welcoming. bright carbonation, light to medium body, well hidden abv, nice funky, spicy and herbal relatively dry finish.

Bouteille 375ml, courtoisie de YULbier. De couleur rouge-rosée foncée et voilée. Nez fruité acide et légèrement sûres (cerises sûres, notes de canneberges, traces de raisins vineux), de levures sauvages aux notes rustiques, épicées (poivre doux) et terreuses, moyennement boisé (bois humide) avec des traces de fromage vieilli. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture aux notes vineuses. Goût moyennement aigre de fruits (cerises sûres, notes de canneberges et de raisins vineux, traces de citron) et de levures sauvages, terreuses et légèrement rustiques accompagné dun goût boisé asséchant (bois humide, léger de fût de chêne) dès lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute des petites notes de fromage vieilli, dalcool vineux doux et quelques traces herbeuses en toute fin de gorgée. Post-goût long et sec, moyennement aigre de levures sauvages et de fruits (cerises sûres, traces de raisins vineux) avec un léger goût boisé.

375 ml bottle that I cant remember where I got. Pours ruby red with a frothy and fizzy deep pink head that quickly dissipates while leaving a small trace on the glass. Smell is tart, funky and fruity with sour cherries, cherries, crackers, lemon juice, lemon grass, barnyard, leather, dry soil, rich red wine, horse blanket, hay, unripe berries, cherry hard candy and hints of alcohol and gastric acid. Taste is sour, tart and fruity with crackers, sour cherries, cherries, crackers, lemon juice, lemon zest, cherry hard candy, moist wood, rich red wine, cherry pits, dry soil, horse blanket, hay, sour milk, unripe berries and hints of alcohol. Mouthfeel is rich, fruity tart, smooth and medium bodied. finish is tart and fruity with cherries, sour cherries, crackers, lemon zest, hay, barnyard, unripe berries and cherry pits. Intensely fruity, deep and intense...
750 ml bottle. 1983 vintage at Kulminator. Pours a dark orange/mahogany. Aromas of light bitter cherries and barnyard. Flavors of old barrel wood and oranges. Still quite tart and sour. Wow.

375 ml corked and caged bottle, at home, harvest 2011. Poured into a tulip glass. ABV 8%
Nice deep red ruby colour on the body, with lots of activity in it. Two fingers of deep pink head, going down fast, and ending up to a thin line of foam around the glass walls, with no lacing left behind.
Very nice aroma, lots of acrid cherries, funk.
Wow, what a sourness! Very acidic, cherries on the taste and white grapes, along with a bit of dirt on the aftertaste.
Thin body with lots of carbonation, Tart on the palate but only a bit.
Good beer, maybe a bit too sour for me, as I am new to this genre.

Toer de Geuze 2013

Super nice Kriek beer.

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2015 Multiple bottles over time. Mostly fresh or within 3 years of bottling.

Poured from a 375 mL bottle into a tulip.

It pours a deep ruby color with a nice foamy cherry colored head.

The aroma is sweet and slightly tart cherry, Musty oak, vanilla, and some balsamic vinegar in the background.

Boon Kriek starts off with a sweet cherry flavor with a little bit of vanilla.  Slowly the flavor turns tart and sour, with an acetic undertone.  

The mouthfeel is a little bit on the full side to start out with, but it lightens up a little bit as the sip progresses.  The carbonation is creamy and imparts a smooth character.  It is not intensely sour, but somewhat acetic and vinegary. 

This is quite a solid Kriek.

Bottle shared by CaseyK...thanks Casey! - Definitely the gem of the GTMW line tasting for me. Pours hazy ruby with a pink foamy head. Nose is big cherry funk, lightly tart and BOLD cherries. *(cuvée 2008): Extrêmement juteux à ma grande surprise avec un assèchement rapide et franc. Très accessible côté sauvage et acidité mais pas simplet, au contraire, très accompli.

Hazy dark red with a pink head. Aroma is sweet, cherries, wood and tart. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 010512

2008 vintage, 375 ml bottle, pours deep garnet with a foamy pink head, aroma is rich cherry, heavy funk, some must, light, tart, and dry with a nice clean acidic finish, snappy sour cherry throughout, delightful

Bottle at Monks. Pours a cloudy neon red with a soft pink head. Some lacing.  Sour cherry up front.  Fuller cherry flavor as it warms. Fizzy and acidic on the tongue.  Heavier body than expected.  Top tier Kriek!

375ml bottle. Pours a dark blood red with a small clear rose head. Nose : Strongs aromas of cherry wjavascript: RadioSel(overall,16);ith some wood raisin notes. (Bottle) Pours dark red with a creamy pink head. 2008 vintage. Pours Ruby red color with pale reddish head. Sour cherry and funky aromas. Sour cherry flavor with with some musty funkiness. Medium body with effervescent carbonation.
Bottle from 2008.Deep ruby colour with slight reddish head.Aroma is sourish and sweet of ripped cherries and champagne less sour then some others kriek beer and also more marcipan flavor.

2009 vintage. Dark ruby with a pink fizz of head stilling to nothing and a perfect, cask-like tingle of sustained carbonation. Aroma saliva-prompting, tannic fruit skin (blackcurrant), liquorice (purple Allsorts?), buttery oak, Chianti, cave. Creamy, oaked; the acidity counterpointed beautifully by a flavour I can only describe as cave-aged cherry custard. Almost smoked, TCP-hinting, oaky, creamy afters. But puckering and tannic with it. Like a very fine, expensive, oaked red wine..except drinkable and complex. World class. And unlike any beer Ive sampled to date.

Olut kaatuu lasiin kauniin viinin punaisena ja muodostaa punertavan vaahdon. Tuoksu on erittäin marjainen ja kirsikkainen. Myös mausteinen. Maussa on happamuutta, marjoja ja kirsikkaa. Hiilihappoja tästä löytyy yllinkyllin. Kirpakka ja pirtsakka olut.

#1205 bottle; cherry, hay, barn yard, decent cherry, feel Is watery, carb is mediumheavy, taste is sour red grape, some barn yard, little marcipan

2008 bottle, big cherry funky horse blanket barnyard goodness. Sweet taste, not that funky. Dry finish, this is tasty!

Hazy, dark red with a thick pink head. Fruity with earthy notes. Sour, acidic and fruity. Full body with a long, bitter / sour after taste.
aroma is mostly earthy funk and lemon rind. flavor is sweet-sour, too sweet, but with a cherry juiciness. dry and fizzy but smooth, lemony fruity finish, very good but really too sweet

Taste is cherries up front, then tart barn-like funkiness soon fading into some slightly unpleasant metallic notes. Wood and citrus in the finish. An OK kriek which could have been great with some extra touches and devoid of metal. Still pretty good, all in all.
Bottle. A well made beer. Not very sour nor the most complex kriek. All though well balanced and highly drinkable. Sweet cherries at first, and then the earthiness comes through in the aftertaste.
Bottle. Red beer, pink head. Sour cherry aroma, rubber and berries. Cherry flavor, sourish and sweet, berries, some rubber. Nicelt balanced.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Deep red with a large pink head.
Full cherry-aroma with sour notes.
Pretty sweet and big cherry-flavour. Slightly oily palate with medium sourness.

From bottle @Brouwerij Frank Boon, Lembeek. Big airy pink head. Body is unclear red/ruby. Rich cherry aroma,  with a fine dryness and some metal notes.  Very flavorfull.  Natural, juicy cherries. A light sour undertone, notes of wood, almonds and earth. More than medium full. Juicy texture. Dryish cherry finish with a pleasant acidity. Good stuff.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2011 375 ml bottle from Systembolaget. 2008 vintage. Dark red/pink, hazy liquid with small pink head. Looks like a kriek should. Smells sour with notes of cherries, barnyard, funk, oak, leather. Nice. Taste is very dry with medium sourness/tartness. Balanced sourness, not to much and not too little. Lots of cherries. Light to medium bodied with nice carbonation and long lingering finish. Nice one, absolutely.
2008 bottle consumed in 2011.   pleasant leathery funk. moderate lactic sourness.    balanced nicely by creamy, leathery, cherry fruit.  nice balance.   enjoyeable.

1995 bottle shared by ygbtsm in the party room after the rbsg 2011 grand tasting in philly.  Pours super dense, midnight red, with pinkish lace.  Extremely funky, sour, cherry, oak, leather.  Really great.  Thanks Brad.

Pours hazy ruby, almost purple, with a thin head. Huge fruity aroma with lots of sour cherries. Taste is sour but very well balanced, dry and tart with lots of cherry flavor, along with some oak and a light funkiness. Delicious.

som väntat hade den mycket trevliga ektoner i doften.
Smaken full av körsbär och svarta vinbär, lagom syrlighet och en fin balans.
Kan dricka många sådana i år.

Bottle, 2008 vintage:Pours a deep, red colour, no head. Tart, vinegary aroma with some earthy stable notes. Flavour is sour and has notes of cherrie stones, raspberries, moist cellars and winter apples.

Bottle at Sorbon in Bromma. It poured a dark hazy red liquid with a small light red head. Taste and smell of cherries, wine and grapes. Both sour and sweet taste. Semi-smooth mouthfeel, strong carbonation and medium thick body. A very nice and complex kriek.

Bottle. (vintage 2008)

Dark red with a nice fluffy pink head. Aroma and taste of cherries, oak, almonds and some light spices. Dry with a nice sourness. Nicely balanced and really a great beer.

2008 version, from bottle, shared with other Norwegians attending Toer de Geuze 2011. Pink coloured head. Deep ruby-red body. Smell of sweet and dry berries. Dusty dry flavour with cherries. Well bodied. Nice (Lembeek, 01.05.2011).

1983 Sehr korkiger Geruch, bedingt säuerlicher Antrunk, sehr erfrischend, die Kirschen sind natürlich und in der Intensität angenehm. Erfrischend, was für ein 26 Jahre altes Bier eine Meisterleistung ist! Typisch trocken in der Säure, wovon das Bier auch im Abgang nicht lässt. Sehr ausgewogenes Bier, das wunderbar gealtert ist. /11/11/11/9/11
Garnet pour with a minimal head. Tons of sour cherry funk, and the usual excellent balance of acidity you get from Boon. Super dry and puckering mouthfeel- a winner for sure.
Cherry pour with a pink.purplish head.  Aroma is sour, horsey cherry, cherry pit.  Flavor is more of the same, sour cherries, bit of lactic sourness with a dry sour finish.  Tasty

Big purple head. Deep dark red barely translucent body. Deep cherry and almonds aroma. Dry-sour-sweet cherry and wax taste. Mid-bodied. Mild mouthfeel with acid bite. Dry-sweet fruity cherry almonds aftertaste with honey notes. Very nice. Balanced, harmonic, rich, and smooth. (0.375l bottle at brewery.)

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2011 2008 vintage 375ml bottle at home. The aroma is funk with almonds along with cherry stones. The pour presents a deep red beer touching on purple which produces a strong pink head. The taste is excellent. It really is the perfect marriage of flavours. There is oak, funk, cherry, lambic and almonds. The palate is very full but the beer is 8%. This lambic is not very sour yet but the residual sugars will get eaten eventually which will produce a more sour beer. This beer will age fantastically well but if you want a more sour hit then let the beer age until 2016. The best before is 2030. This is right up there with the best.

Bottle brought back by the boss from Belgium. Red with a light pink head. Lots of dusty ad funky brett aroma with a touch of oak. Medium-strong sourness that seems to be a good mix of cherry and lactic. Just a light fruity sweetness and cherry flavor but the cherries seem quite sour themselves. Robust and pretty balanced. Hard to say but I dont think I liked this as much as the geuze.

(2008 Vintage) Poured a red body with a large fizzy pink head.  Aroma is earthy, grassy, cherry like, with a hint of dried fruit and citrus. Mouthfeel was medium in body and warmth with a biting finish. Flavor of cherry, red plum, grass, and lime.  Sour.. just the way I like it.

Extremely fine head
Dry and aged nose, complexe
Fullbodiet fine length
Very complex 
Interessting

(Bottle, 0.375 l, at One Pint Pub, Helsinki, 20110428) The beer poured deep red and quite clear. Its head was medium sized and pink. Aroma had cherries, cherry stones and sourness. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were sourness, fruitiness, cherries, malts and low bitterness. Aftertaste was sour and dry. A decent kriek but I would have enjoyed more sourness.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2011 Bottled. Extremely fast diminishing head. Cork and cherry are present throughout. Medium to full bodied. Balanced sourness. The alcohol is nicely hidden. Very pleasant and flawless.

Thanks to drabmuh for letting me nab one of these out of some box he ordered. Split with Amyliz4 and served in a Hill Farmstead wine glass. 2007 Vintage.

Pours a really nice red color with a beautiful pink head that sticks around for quite some time, leaving behind ample lacing. The nose has a bit of a dry herbal character along with some oak and cherries. Mild acid in there as well. The flavor has more dry earthiness and an odd herbal character. Cherries are fairly minimal. Bit of an oak presence with a touch of tannin. Dry finish without too much acid. Nowhere near as good as the plain Mariage Parfait.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-26-2011

Beautiful dark red. Clear with a big pink head that fades quickly. No lacing. Smells funky with a big peppery woodiness in the background. Taste the same. With a slight cork flavor and a nice crisp tartness left behind. Subtly  sweet as well. Very good. Why cant the good beers be in bigger supply?

Bottle of the 2008.  Pours a big deep ruby and garnet with some brown tinge and a large soft pink head.  Soft funk and a touch of sweet cherry, dusty and delicate.  Medium bodied, lightly funky with a touch of dried cherry.  Leathery and bretty.  Funky and dry, very light dusty cherry on the finish.  Pretty nice.

375 ml from TheEpeeist. Thanks, Chris! We dont seem to get this around these parts. Just the Gueze. Pours a murky deep berry hue, purple and red, well hazed, with big cakey pink head atop, dies down slowly, a thicker film, ok lacing overall. Deep red berry like cranberry juice. Aromas are sour cherries, cherry skins, wet oak, touches of lactic acid, yogurt, some light touches of vinegar, touches of more sour cherries, malty breads, and touches of funky brett, dust, and hay grow as it warms more. Initial is lighter bodied, with some light sour cherries, faint vinegar, a bit sweeter for my liking. Some cherry juice, touches of wet oak, vanilla tannins, a touch of cough drops (but not full blown cough syrup). A touch more spritzy tartness on the backend, cherry skins, and bready malts, light bretty funk, dryness. The beer isnt too sweet, but it lacks the oomph of some of my favorite Krieks. An ok beer, a touch sweet overall. Would love to see it with some more age. Lacks complexity and depth, could use some more "wild yeast" life.

Tart cherry aroma.  Deep cherry-red with pink head.  A well-balanced, slightly tart, musty cherry.

Notes: Bottle at Zythos 11

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2012 2008 vintage opened March 2011.
A: Rich transparent red body. Small, pinkish fizzy head. Decent retention. Very spotty lacing.
S: Tart cherries with a soft oaky must. Only the slightest hint of funk.
T: All said, a tasty, but not overly complex kriek. Lacking the depth and variety of cherry flavors that some of the better representatives deliver. The oak is mild, the funk is faint.
M: Smooth, medium bodied. Perhaps a bit thin towards the finish.
O: As noted above, not the best representative... but certainly a respectable offering.

37,5cl bottle. Pours a cloudy dark ruby colour with a big pink head. Quickly vanishing foam. Wonderfully complex aroma: lots of cherries, hay, flowers. Lightly sweet, moderately acidic flavor, becomes moderately sour. Taste is definitely more complex and warming than other krieks, probably due to higher ABV. Acidic, pretty dry finish. Very nice cherries presence. Medium body, lively carbonation. Awesome

(bottle) pours a hazy dark ruby colour with a frothy dark pink head. aroma of spicy cherry pulp and citrus fruits, with notes of milk chocolate, pepper and herbs. flavour is almost exactly the same, fruity, herbal and spicy, with a hint of bread and a medium to strong sourness. medium-bodied with lively carbonation.

Bottle at Akkurat. Deep red color, pink head. Aroma is very fruity with cherries (of course). Flavour is very fruity, and it becomes slightly sweet at first (if compared to other krieks) but it ends dry and sour. Refreshing carbonation.
Deep dark red with a pink head. Lots of cherries, but they arent very sour. Still manages to give you that nice cheekdrying feeling though.

375 ml Bottle from Tanakaya. 2007 vintage. Drank with Sakiko on Valentines Day with chocolate fondue. Lovely, fruity aroma of yogurt cream, almonds, cherry. Deep, beautiful crimson with a fine, fluffy, cyclamen-in-snow head. Slight sour flavor with lactic notes, nuts, leather, and less cherry than the nose, but they are there. Strong lambic character, lots of leather and barnyard, with underlying fruity sweetness. Excellent. A mature, adults kriek. Did not come across as sweet as many other people here have said.

i like the fruityness from the krieken!
Fine pearl and red/pink head. (thoughts of champagne)
Nice carbonisation, a perfect aperitif in summer!

Bottle. 2008 vintage. Poured into a tulip glass a bright, vibrant red color with a pink collared head. Very funky aroma with an underlying sweet cherry note. Some wood as well. Light mouthfeel with good carbonation. More sweet than I was expecting. Slightly tart cherry. Id be interesting to see if this would sour up with some time onas of now its just more sweet. Slight medicinal notes.

375ml bottle. Pour is a darkish ruby red with a quickly diminishing head of pink foam. Aroma is filled with funky sourness but the cherries are also a big presence.  The flavor is nice, upfront bubbles and tartness instantly clear the palate, then the cherry flavors linger, not sour, not funky, just cherry.  Im happy with the aroma, but I was looking for a bit more funk to the flavor.  Its even a little sweet at the end, which is a surprise.

375ml bottle (Brugs Beertje)
8 Just inhaling the freshly poured beer is an end to itself. The light fruitiness is beautiful, but the sharpness of the lambic fills the nose and goes all the way down the back of the throat
4 Deep red, brief head
8 Slightly bananaey retronasals. Very gentle malty body, just light grains, and a very subtle cherry component.
4 Refreshing palate, pleasant carbonation.
15 Absolutely lovely lambic, beautifully crisp. Refreshing, and giving no clue to the strength.

2008 vintage. HUGE thanks to jkane101 for the hook-up!

A- Uniformly translucent fushcia body with vibrant color. Pours with a 1 1/2 finger soapy light pink head. 1/2 finger retains nicely.

S- Nose is slightly sweet but vell balanced. Vinegar comes through the most initially as well as a slight acidic tartness-but the rest of the characters rush in quickly-oak, vanilla, sour cherry, and slightly sweet cherry.

T- Cherry, oak, vinegar and vanilla come through initially. Finish is slightly more tart than initial flavor-but with a similar profile. The tartness lingers slightly more than the rest of the profile-but nothing is overpowering and amazingly all the initial flavors linger slightly.

M- Well done. Smooth, slightly yeasty medium wieght body with soft carbonation.

D- This is a very good, well balanced lambic overall. Certainly one of my favorite krieks. This was a nice surprise as well as I wasnt expecting this brew to be SO good. Would love to have this again!

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 06-25-2010 02:23:31
(2008) smells like funky sour cherries, minty, tastes like funk, earth, cherries, AMAZING!  Best cherry lambic Ive had in a while.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2015 Bouteille de 37,5 cl, Mousse correcte avec une certaine tenue, couleur betterave rouge. Un breuvage raffiné mais je mattendais à quelque chose de plus aromatique et à vrai dire, cest un peu trop sec pour mes goûts. trouvée à Vanuxeem - Ploegstaert.
2008 Bottle. Red ruby pour with some white bubbling head. Whole cherries, tartness, some light caramel flavor and thorough funk through out. Finishes with a light warming.

12.7 oz bottle, 2007.  Clear garnet with a puffy pink head.  Nose is cherry, barnyard and lemon.  Medium body with sparkling then soft carb.  Taste is black cherry, toffee and red apple peels.  Finishes dry and minerally with just a trace of sour fruit.  Classy stuff.

Bottle from еtreĞourmet cons 2010-11-27 Sätila
AR: sour sweet mix of kriek
AP: amber, wee fizzy head
F: fizzy, wee fudgy loads of kriek, sourness of course but more precautious and great balanced, maderia tones

In courtesy of Nisse666. Pours hazy cherry red with small pink head. Fresh fruity and berry - not l ike a kriek - slightly sweet and intense sour aroma. Crispy, sweet and fruity mouthfeel. Lovely balanced sour, fruity, sweet and tart cherry flavor with notes of peppermint . Sour and fruity balanced palate. Finishes nice thin with great fruity dry acidity.

(Bottled, 2007 harvest) Clear, deep blood ruby red with a small, pinkish head. Quite tart nose with natural and strong, dark cherry aroma. Flavor is mostly ripe cherries, with tartness and some sticky sugar. Medium to full body, soft carbonation. Quite sweet overall, but the 8% is perfectly hidden, and I liked the full, dark-cherryish body (distantly reminiscent of the excellent De Cam Kriekenlambik). 5266

2006 vintage 
head: pink , away fast !
